data.title: Font Alignment properties for the Textfield inside starling.display.Button
data.body:
Properties fontVAlign and fontHAlign created to set and get the value
of mTextield.vAlign and mTextield.hAlign

data.title: Replacing multiple eventListeners with one
data.body:
Hi!
I am proposing a small optimization change to the demo source where instead of adding an eventListener to each button of the main menu, only one eventListener is added to the 'Game.as' constructor. Also I am adding a condition to the onButtonTriggered method to deal with events generated by the back button in the 'Scene.as' class. This also allows to simplify the 'Scene.as' class, by removing its own onBackButtonTriggered method.
Hope it helps,
Cheers.

data.title: Docs update request!
data.body:
> **PrimaryFeather:**
> Only textures that were created with "Texture.fromBitmap(Data)" are "real", concrete textures and can (and need) to be disposed.

Any chance you could add that to the docs? That'd be really useful. I'm lucky I remembered this after coming across it a while ago. Others may not be so lucky, though.

data.title: Batch drawTriangles with different textures.
data.body:
Essentially, what is contained within this excellent article: http://blog.flash-core.com/?p=493

Batch sprite groups that use up to 4 different textures in 1 call. Considering you find performance a constant goal for starling, adding the option for this could come in very handy to those who know what they're doing. When so, they could simply set something like `enableMultiTextureBatching`. I guess the details would be up to you.

Anyway, just  figured I'd bring this article to your attention. Hope it turns out to be useful! :smiley:

data.title: TextField bitmap fonts DO work across starling instances and a recent change breaks my app
data.body:
I have an app where I have 2 Starling instances with an Away3D view sandwiched between.  I have bitmap fonts which were shared between the 2 instances and appear to have been working correctly.

I just updated to HEAD and got a new version of TextField.as which has the following change:
"a bitmap font will only work in one Starling instance,, they are saved in Starling's 'customData' property"

This breaks my app.
It appears to me that BitmapFonts should be shareable by multiple Starling instances that share the same Context3D.  Why would this not be the case?

data.title: Allow filter subclasses to override the default location of shader attributes
data.body:
This makes it easier to hook up filters to shaders that have come from places that don't have good control over what location they expect shader attributes/constants to be stored in. For me this made it easier to hook up the backend of glsl2agal(https://github.com/adobe/glsl2agal) to a starling filter: 

Here is the example usecase:

https://github.com/alexmac/StarlingFilterPlayground/blob/master/src/starling/filters/GLSLFilter.as

And in action:

http://alexmac.github.com/StarlingFilterPlayground

data.title: multitouchEnabled to true disable the TRIGGERED event
data.body: When adding the flag 'Starling.multitouchEnabled = true' it disable the TRIGGERED events of buttons and also the downState auto effect.

data.title: Added a removeEventListener in the onAddedToStage method.
data.body: Hi, I am totally new to GitHub so sorry if this is not the way it's done but I am working with the Starling scaffold project for iOS and I found that in the Game.as file there seemed to be a removeEventListener in the onAddedToStage method. Hope this helps and thanks for the great framework that Starling is!

data.title: Possible batching bug?
data.body:
Shouldn't `QuadBatch` objects be batched if their state is the same? I figured that since there is a [`QuadBatch::addQuadBatch()`](http://doc.starling-framework.org/core/starling/display/QuadBatch.html#addQuadBatch%28%29) method, my 3 `QuadBatch` objects _(all with the same state according to the wiki, texture, tint etc)_ should be batched resulting in 1 overall draw call. Although according to the stats display it's saying 3 draw calls are occurring.

I'm really confused.

data.title: Filter.cache() - bug when object has alpha < 1
data.body: If object alpha is less than 1 cached filter looks different than original.

data.title: Apply skew after scaling
data.body:
This matches what the Flash authoring tool does. It also matches what
happens with rotation - i.e., that it is applied after scaling, making a
rotation by way of skewing (i.e. setting skewX and skewY to the same
value) give the same result as setting rotation directly.

data.title: Feature Request: Functionality similar to BitmapData.paletteMap()
data.body:
Unless there's a hidden workaround already available _(I haven't found any plugins for this either)_ I need to be able to recolour an `Image` object using a `Vector` or `Array` of values. Essentially so that I can say every pixel with the colour `0xFF0000` should be replaced with the colour `0x00FF00`.

I'm not sure if the new filters feature could possibly allow for this? I really don't know, I have zero experience with low level stuff like this on the GPU. I pretty much just want to have a single avatar texture coloured using different shades of grey then I can use this new function to recolour it on the fly to give him a different skin colour, hair colour etc. It's a lot cheaper than storing an image of every possible avatar.

Reference to the function I'm talking about: [`BitmapData.paletteMap()`](http://help.adobe.com/en_US/FlashPlatform/reference/actionscript/3/flash/display/BitmapData.html#paletteMap%28%29)
Additional reference to my original post on the Starling forum: [Alternative to BitmapData.paletteMap() ?](http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/alternative-to-bitmapdatapalettemap)

data.title: QuadBatch alpha blending bug.
data.body:
Scenario: I am adding 2 opaque `Image` objects to a `QuadBatch` object. One is a background, the other is a picture of a building. Now, if I set the `alpha` property of the `QuadBatch` object to something like `0.5`, you can see part of the background bleed through the picture of the building.

Example: http://i.imgur.com/EmyL6.png

I can't seem to find a workaround, I tried using all `BlendMode` types but that doesn't seem to fix anything so I am assuming this is a bug.

data.title: Added option to ignore mipmaps when loading ATF data
data.body: Simple change to give an option to ignore mipmaps on ATFs. DXT5 textures have to have mip maps. The current ATF tool has an option to generate blank mip maps which compress well, but the default implementation will still try to use them if a sprite is scaled (which gives an empty sprite). This option allows us to get around this.

data.title: Starling sticking around in memory after dispose/null
data.body:
Outlined here in a thread, after starting a new Starling instance with a simple class that only creates and adds a Quad, then disposing, Starling is still left in memory. 

Post:
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/starling-is-sticking-around-in-ram-general-tips-on-what-to-look-for

Reproducable from this simple example Flex project:
http://www.ertp.com/tmp/StarlingRestartMemoryDemo.zip

A System.gc() nor FlashBuilder forced GC gets rid of the instances.

data.title: Please make the transition methods on Transitions public
data.body:
I'd like to do some new combinations and don't want to necessarily have to rewrite helper functions like easeCombined.

Thanks!

data.title: add a pause getter and setter to Juggler
Optional scaling when viewport width & height != stage width & height
data.body:
Hi there,

It seems it's currently presumed that if the viewport width & height differs from the stage.stageWidth and stage.stageHeight,  the user wishes to scale the Starling content to fit the viewport size.

https://github.com/PrimaryFeather/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling/src/starling/core/Starling.as#L366

In my use case, I need the content to be clipped rather than scaled, so have hacked it like this for now:

```
var scaleX:Number = 1;//mViewPort.width  / mStage.stageWidth;
var scaleY:Number = 1;//mViewPort.height / mStage.stageHeight;
```

Could you please consider making the scaling optional in a future release?

Thanks!
Rob

data.title: Object disposed error when trying to add an Image to a QuadBatch after previously disposing the context.
data.body: This is essentially what has been discussed [here](http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/restoring-rendertexturequadbatch-after-render-context-is-lost) but now that I seem to be getting the hang of github, I figured it would be worth posting here so that it's easier to track!

data.title: Re-adding tween to juggler after Tween advanceTime called
Clone image and replaceChildAt
data.body: Hi, I'm using both functions in my framework. Maybe it could be useful for you too.

data.title: StatsDisplay TextField Texture Bug (Error #3605: Sampler 0 binds an invalid texture)
data.body:
When you turn on then off the stats display, dispose of a Starling instance, and re-initialize a new Starling instance the TextField object in the StatsDisplay throws an exception:

Error: Error #3605: Sampler 0 binds an invalid texture.
at flash.display3D::Context3D/drawTriangles()

I believe this may be happening because the texture on the default font (BitmapFont.MINI) that was registered when StatsDisplay creates a TextField may be being disposed of or something when the StatsDisplay is turned off. Not sure whats going on there.

I mentioned this on the Starling forum as well: http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/statsdisplay-textfield-bug-error-3605-sampler-0-binds-an-invalid-texture

When I call:

TextField.unregisterBitmapFont(BitmapFont.MINI, true);

this error disappears.

data.title: Access to nativeWidth/nativeHeight on Texture
data.body:
Hi,

Over on the graphics extension, I'm hitting a small problem with generating UV coordinates for dynamic fills.

If someone creates a texture from a 100x100 source file, then internally Starling will be scaling this to 128x128.

If someone then draws a textured 100x100 rectangle with this texture - the graphics extension calculates the uv coordinate like so :

```
u = vertex.x * 1/texture.width
v = vertex.y * 1/texture.height
```

This will place the texture at the same position/scale as flash's native graphics API.

However, because texture.width/height report the original width, this calculation will be off if the source image differed in dimension to the nearest power of 2.

I'm working around this at the moment by re-calculating getNextPowerOfTwo() - which works fine. But it would be a bit nicer if I could get read-only access to the native width height parameters.

data.title: null mViewPortClipped during render() when used with shared context
data.body:
1. Use Starling with shared context (e.g Away3D)
2. when _starling.render() is called, an exception occurs because of mVIewPortClipped is null.

It seems that mViewPortClipped has never been created if mSharedContext is true, see updateViewport(). 

On method updateViewPort(), moving the line:

``` actionscript
if (mShareContext) return;
```

to below:

``` actionscript
mViewPortClipped = mViewPort.intersection(new Rectangle(0, 0, mNativeStage.stageWidth, mNativeStage.stageHeight));
```

seems to fix this problem

data.title: Add isJuggling() to Juggler and getTouchByID to TouchEvent
data.body:
1. I have a static constant that needs to be added to Starling's juggler. If the Starling instance is disposed, and a new one is created, then this will help me determine if I need to add my constant to the new juggler or not.
2. We discussed getTouchByID() previously. This will help avoid a lot of redundant multi-touch code where one only cares about a specific touch ID after TouchPhase.BEGAN.

data.title: Get the Starling view port without creating a new object
data.body:
The viewPort getter always clones the current view port. Makes sense, but if I need to check the view port every frame, I'd prefer to pass in an existing rectangle to populate to avoid object allocation.

Something like this would be nice:

```
function getViewport(resultRect:Rectangle = null):Rectangle
```

data.title: root is not always the child at index 0
Reinstantiating Starling multiple times
data.body:
Per the post linked below, Starling appears unable to dispose and reaquire context. After initial instantiation and disposal, new instantiations do not show.

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/proper-startstop-of-starling-instances-mobile
